heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 13 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.2°C) and outside temperature (down 1.8°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 139 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 3702 lux) and cloud levels (up 275 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 139.0m lower than yesterday, 82.8m higher than the past week, 275.5m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1039m minimum and 2260m maximum, with an average of 1327.2m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1244.5m and 1602.7m.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, pleasant humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and a mix of sun and clouds. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
